lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.main.duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main.duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Behaves as a task manager to keep record of the different tasks.
* Creates a Duke object that takes in a filepath for reading and writing of data.
* @param filePath Path in which the list of task is stored.
* Handles user command and give an appropriate reply.
* @param userInput commands specified by the user.
ui.echo("Duke.Main.Duke has noticed that the number you provided does not \nmatch the number of task you have." +
ui.echo("OOPS!!! Please enter a valid task number!");
* Takes in the given user input and return a newly created task specified by the user.
* Catches any invalid command and reply appropriately.
* @param type Type of task to be created.
* @return A new task specified by the user.
private Task getTask(String[] userInput, Type type) {
ui.echo("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a " + userInput[0] + " cannot be empty.");
ui.echo("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
ui.echo("☹ OOPS!!! Description is empty or invalid timeframe!");
ui.echo("☹ OOPS!!! Duke.Main.Duke could not understand given date!"
* Returns a boolean depending on Duke understanding the given command.
* @return True if Duke understands the command, false otherwise.
* Returns a boolean that signifies the user's wish to end the program.
* Returns user commands as an Enum type.
* @return An Enum type corresponding to the user's command.
* Handles reading and writing of data.
* Creates a Storage object that has access to the text file as specified by the filepath.
* @param filePath Path in which the text file is stored or to be stored.
* Reads data from the text file and output it as a list of tasks.
* @return An array list consisting of all previously stored tasks.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Duke.Main.Duke is unable to locate your file!");
* Saves the current tasks into the text file as specified by the filepath.
* @param list List of tasks created by the user.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Duke.Main.Duke is unable to write to your file!");
* Creates a Deadline object with description of the task.
* @param description Description of the deadline task.
* @param by Date in which the task is due.
* Prints out the details of the Deadline task.
* @return A string with details of the Deadline task.
* Creates an Event object with description of the task.
* @param description Description of the deadline task.
* @param at Date in which the task is due.
* Prints out the details of the Event task.
* @return A string with details of the Event task.
* Creates a Task object with the relevant details.
* @param charId A character corresponding to the type of task created.
* @param date Date in which the task is due.
public Task(String description, String charId, LocalDate date) {
* Marks the task as completed or incomplete.
* @param mark A boolean to mark or unmark a task.
* @param show A boolean to print Duke's reply to the user.
public void markTask(boolean mark, boolean show) {
output = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n";
output = "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n";
* Returns 'X' if the task is mark, a space, ' ' otherwise.
* @return 'X' if the task is mark, a space, ' ' otherwise.
* Returns a description of the task.
* Returns the char representation of the task.
* @return The char representation of the task.
* Returns the date in which the task is due.
* @return The date in which the task is due.
* Prints out the details of the task.
* @return A string with details of the task.
* Creates A Todo object with details of the task.
* @param description Description of the todo task.
* Prints out the details of the Todo task.
* @return A string with details of the Todo task.
* Creates a TaskList object that initializes a new list if list was not null.
* Adds a new task to the list.
* @param task Task to be added to the list.
new Ui().echo("Got it. I have added this task:\n" + task
+ "\nNow you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Removes a specific task in the list.
* @param pos Position at which the task in the list is to be removed.
new Ui().echo("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + description + "\nNow you have " + list.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Mark the task to be completed in the list.
* @param pos Position at which the task is to be marked completed.
* Unmark the task in the list.
* @param pos Position at which the task is to be unmarked.
* Returns a list of tasks in detail in the order which it was added.
System.out.println("Here are the task in your list:");
* Populate the list with tasks saved in the text file.
* @param data Tasks from the text file to be populated into the list.
* Finds a task by searching for a keyword.
* @param input Keyword specified by the user.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! Duke searched high and low but could not find the task that you want!");
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! The description of the find command cannot be empty!");
* Handles outputting of visuals to the user.
* Shows a welcome message to the user upon running the program.
System.out.println(logo + "\nHello! I'm Duke.Main.Duke\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Prints a goodbye message to the user.
echo("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints the message between two horizontal lines.
* Prints a horizontal dash to mark the start or end of a message.
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("Return book", date);
Event event = new Event("New Year party", date);
assertEquals("[E][ ] New Year party (at: Jan 1 2022)", event.toString());
